abstract.value: The Morgan Jin Collection on the <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph> Minorities Class Action Suit documents the 1974 class action lawsuit brought against the <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph> by Morgan Jin and other <emph render="italic">Times</emph> employees alleging racial discrimination in hiring and promoting. The collection dated 1942-1992, the bulk of the material from 1974-1981, predominantly consists of photocopies of court and legal documents, correspondence, and articles and clippings related to the suit.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Morgan Jin Collection on the New York Times Minorities Class Action Suit; WAG 227; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
The collection was probably donated by Morgan Jin and/or his son David Jin at an unknown date. The accession number associated with this material is 1950.051.
Sources: "Morgan Jin Discusses Historic NY Times Affirmative Action Suit." <emph render="italic">East/West: The Chinese American Journal</emph>, vol. 15, no. 21, 27 May 1981.

The Morgan Jin Collection on the <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph> Minorities Class Action Suit documents the 1974 class action lawsuit brought against the <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph> by Morgan Jin and other <emph render="italic">Times</emph> employees alleging racial discrimination in hiring and promoting. The collection, dated 1942-1992, the bulk of the material from 1974-1981, predominantly consists of photocopies of court and legal documents, correspondence between counsel, Morgan Jin and other plaintiffs, and news clippings related to the suit. Articles and clippings also relate to racial discrimination, particularly workplace discrimination against people of color in news media, and the oppressions faced by Asian and Asian American workers. This collection also includes documentation about Jin's history, his work at the <emph render="italic">Times</emph>, notes on the legal actions, and clippings related to his other labor organizing and advocacy efforts.
